bodylog.ui.tables.abstracts

Class EditorTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
      • javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel
        • bodylog.ui.tables.abstracts.EditorTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, TableModel
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MoveEditorTable, SessionEditorTable

    public abstract class EditorTable
extends DefaultTableModel
    Abstract TableModel class acting as a base for TableModels used in editing Moves or Sessions. Used in. Extends DefaultTableModel which already contains the functionality for receiving user input but uses the obsolete collection Vector. Should create a custom TableModel with editing capability.
    See Also:
    SessionEditor, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • setValueAt

        public void setValueAt(Object value,
                       int row,
                       int column)
        Sets the value in the specified cell. Checks if the value is acceptable by calling parseValue to parse the input. If the parsing fails and returns null, the value is not set into the table. This causes the input to disappear, prompting to user to try again. The table should have a ToolTip that describes acceptable inputs.
        Specified by:
        setValueAt in interface TableModel
        Overrides:
        setValueAt in class DefaultTableModel
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be added
        row - the row
        column - the column
        See Also:
        SessionEditor, MoveEditor

      • rowHasBeenEdited

        public boolean rowHasBeenEdited(int row)
        Checks if a row has been changed from the default state. Used for checking the last row before removing it.
        Parameters:
        row - the row to be checked
        Returns:
        true when all values in the row are null, false otherwise

      • parseValue

        protected abstract Object parseValue(Object value,
                                     int row,
                                     int column)
        Defines the method with which input into cells is parsed into proper values for this table. A failed parsed is signaled by returning null.
        Parameters:
        value - the input to be parsed
        row - the row of the cell where the input originates
        column - the column of the cell where the input originates
        Returns:
        the parsed value, null if parsing fails

      • defaultRowData

        protected abstract Object[] defaultRowData()
        Sets the default array for a new row.
        Returns:
        an array with default values

      • addRow

        public void addRow()
        Adds a new row to the table model and executes an action associated with that.

        The action taken by this when a row is added.
